details.message: Player 1 does not have enough R to offer.

proposed_trade.rationale: I AM AT (2, 0), MY GOAL IS (3, 3). THE SHORTEST PATH REQUIRES: (2,0)→(3,0)→(3,1)→(3,2)→(3,3), COSTING B:2, R:1, G:1. I HAVE B:12, G:2, R:0 — MISSING 1 R CHIP. THE OTHER PLAYER HAS R:9 AND G:2. A VIABLE ALTERNATIVE PATH IS (3,2)→(3,3), REQUIRING ONLY G:1. SINCE THE OTHER PLAYER IS ALREADY AT (3,2), MOVING DIRECTLY TO (3,3) COSTS 1 G CHIP. IF I CAN GET THEM TO COVER G FOR ME, THEY GAIN FROM THE CONTRACT: WHEN I REACH GOAL, THEY RECEIVE 6 POINTS. I CAN PROPOSE COVERING R FOR THEM IN EXCHANGE FOR THEM COVERING G FOR ME ONCE. I OFFER TO COVER R:1 FOR THEM (THEY HAVE PLENTY) AND REQUEST THEM TO COVER G:1 FOR ME (WHICH ALLOWS ME TO MOVE WITHOUT SPENDING MY OWN G). THIS HELPS ME AVOID USING ANY OF MY SCARCE CHIPS AND STILL FINISHES WITH HIGH CHIP COUNT. THEY BENEFIT FROM THE CONTRACT TOO. EVEN IF THEY REJECT, I CAN TAKE A SHORTER PATH VIA G WITHOUT TRADE BY USING THEIR PROMISE IF AVAILABLE. BUT SINCE I CAN SECURE THIS TRADE, IT’S STRICTLY BETTER TO COOPERATE ONLY IF BENEFICIAL — HERE IT IS: I SAVE MY G, USE THEIR R COVERAGE, ACHIEVE GOAL FASTER, AND GAIN MORE FINAL SCORE.
